Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.144)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87657) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87657)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 177 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
